revised_title: The Influence of Stress and Strain on the Electrical Conductivity of Metals
tldr: The author investigates the effects of mechanical stress and strain on the electrical conductivity of cobalt, magnesium, steel, and platinum-iridium. The study reveals that the electrical resistance of cobalt increases with longitudinal traction, while the resistance of nickel decreases. The findings contribute to the understanding of the relationship between stress, strain, and electrical properties of metals.
